recipes.title: Oil & Vinegar Dressing
recipes.description: The Easiest Way to Make Your Salad Awesome. This take on a classic oil and vinegar dressing switches a few ingredients to up the awesome factor.
recipes.instructions: Combine all ingredients in...pretty much anything. Shake. Serve.

recipes.title: Avocado Salad Dressing
recipes.description: This dressing is creamy as opposed to liquid-y, so it’s a nice change of pace in terms of both taste and mouth feel.
recipes.instructions: Combine all ingredients in a food processor, and blend until smooth. Add water, just a tsp at a time, to get consistency right.  Add salt, garlic, etc to taste. Place in an airtight jar and refrigerate for up to 10 days.

recipes.title: Nut Butter Veggie Dip
recipes.description: This recipe isn’t just good for you—it’s perfect to bring to parties or football games so people don’t have to eat garbage. Whenever you have guests over your place, make this and serve with veggies. Smile as they anoint you King.
ingredients: 1/2 cup full fat organic coconut milk from the can (check the label to make sure there's no added junk!)
1/2 cup raw almond butter (the ingredients should just say 'almonds')
about a tsp fresh ginger, grated
recipes.instructions: Throw the cilantro into a food processor first to get it chopped up. Add the rest of the ingredients and pulse until smooth. Transfer to a dish and scrape the sides of your food processor with a rubber spatula. Maybe even lick said spatula. Taste, and add spices (salt, pepper, red pepper etc) as necessary. Serve with chopped fresh veggies.

recipes.title: Best Tomato Sauce EVER
ingredients: .5-1 cup organic tomato sauce (The best choice is Pomi, which comes in a carton, not a can.)
1 jalapeno pepper, top removed and seeded if you want a less spicy sauce.
recipes.instructions: Pulse cilantro, jalapeno and garlic in a food processor until finely minced. Heat tomato sauce on medium-high heat, mixing in the cilantro mixture and coconut oil. Once sauce comes to a light boil, reduce heat to low and let simmer until slightly thickened. Add salt to taste.

recipes.title: Dirty Guacamole
recipes.description: Oh, HELL YES. Is there anything better than guacamole? Don’t bother thinking about the question, because the answer is no, there is not. As far as dips go, guac is the bees knees: it’s delish, full of healthy fat, and looks awesome in a stone bowl.
ingredients: 1/2 cup Fresh packed store bought salsa (just tomatoes, onions, herbs and sometimes jalapenos)
recipes.instructions: Mix and eat. Seriously. Make sure you put the pit in the bowl if you don't intend to eat it right away.

recipes.title: Turkey Meatballs
recipes.description: These meatballs are made of turkey, but you could also use lamb or pork, depending on which animals you like to eat.
ingredients: big pinch each of sea salt, cumin, pepper
recipes.instructions: Combine everything but the coconut flour in a medium bowl. Don't be a wuss, just do it with your hands. Roll the meat into medium-large sized balls, coat lightly with coconut flour if desired. Line a 9x13 dish with aluminum foil; place meatballs in the dish. Bake at 400 degrees for about 25 min or until cooked through. Serve with Best Tomato Sauce Ever.
